page.title: 17DUKE OF EDINBURGH'S AWARD
page.content: The Scheme is an introduction to worthwhile leisure activities, a spur to personal achievement, and a guide to the development of junior citizens. It encourages youthful enthusiasm and effort by presenting a challenging programme of activities to all between 14 and 25 throughout the Commonwealth. Entrants follow chosen activities, in own time, from four Sections: Service (to others), Expeditions (adventure and discovery), Skills (personal, social and practical) and Physical Recreation (fitness and performance). The 3 Awards - Bronze (age 14), Silver (15) and Gold (16) - require relevant standards of effort and performance. Individuals participate through an operating authority such as a school; e.g. Bedgebury runs a Bronze Scheme each year for 4th Years, and sometimes Lower Sixths start their Gold.
